rule: No login between 22:00 and 06:00 without multi-factor approval
No more than 2 consecutive after-hours logins within 7 days
No access to more than 5 unique workstations per day without department head approval
No cross-department workstation access without business justification
All role changes require manager approval and security review
No more than 2 role changes per quarter without CISO approval
Access to financial systems requires additional background check
No USB storage devices allowed without encryption and registration
No file transfers >100MB to removable media without approval
No email attachments >5MB to external domains without DLP scan
No uploads to personal cloud storage services (Dropbox, Google Drive, etc.)
rationale: Prevents data leakage to unauthorized cloud services

rule: No access to /etc/shadow, SAM databases, or password files
Port scanning and network enumeration activities are prohibited
Unusual database query patterns trigger immediate review
Excessive access to job search sites during work hours triggers review
Significant changes in browsing entropy require behavior analysis
Significant deviations from established behavioral baselines require investigation
rationale: Detects subtle behavioral changes indicating risk

rule: Rapid acceleration in privilege changes or data access triggers review
rationale: Detects preparation phases of insider attacks

rule: All access must be revoked within 24 hours of termination notification
All user access must be reviewed semi-annually by data owners
Concurrent sessions from multiple locations prohibited
rationale: Ensures compliance with data protection regulations
